checks.title: Minimum number of AGGR function uses
Comparison of string values is avoided where possible
checks.description:
String comparison is not as efficient as set analysis.
Formulas: `Match()`, `MixMatch()`, `WildMatch`, `Pick`, etc.
Use them only when necessary, such as in a load script as part of a `WHERE` clause.
Avoid them in the frontend where possible and create flags in your data load script or use set analysis instead.

checks.title: Calculation conditions are used for visualization objects that display or process a large number of lines
checks.description:
Typically, Qlik Sense has visualizations that are able to display many records (such as tables).
To avoid the possibility of creating large hypercubes, it is recommended that you add calculation conditions to objects so that they only appear after certain selections have been made, thereby rendering less data.
An example of this would be using functions like `GetSelectedCount([Country]) = 1 OR GetPossibleCount([Country]) = 1`.
In this scenario, the user have to select one country when the visualization is available to the user.
